text: Guys, I found this "brand workshop" that, while long and maybe more than we need, has a lot of good info in it.
A file was shared
interesting
Take a look through and tell me what you think. I usually cringe at the idea of "Mission/Vision/Values" but I do think it's pretty helpful in establishing a point of view / personality / voice
and the end result of these exercises is a number of concise brand statements that we can use to inform whatever content framework we come up with.
also, the cow illustration on the last page is pretty awesome.

(sitting next to melissa, which feels odd to type in here) I think this looks similar to some of the stuff we were doing today. In particular, I'm interested in the last exercise that we did today with Jose — which was way more focused on problems/solutions than broad brand stuff
this might be overly structured but i think that it will help us to really distill everything
I actually wonder if this has ENOUGH structure. One of the things I liked about Jose’s approach is that it focus choices - “you can have this or that, but not both"
that said, there are some things that look in this one you sent over Melissa - I wanna read it a little more in depth tonight
also the cow is dope
right, i’d like to hear more about what you guys did today at Smart Mocha
ok i guess i didnt mean overly structured…. maybe i meant overly touchy feely
anyway, if you guys are on board with doing something thorough like this, i am all in

yeah - I think we should have some structured activities for sure. Maybe we can spend a little time tomorrow running you through Jose’s stuff and working on what a good set of activities might be for Hank given what we want to get out of our meeting
i dont want hank to think that this isnt about the website though
agreed

I gotta bounce, but lets touch base tomorrow after our OTHER meeting with Jose and work on what we need to get out of this meeting - keeping in mind the work we’ve already done on the whiteboard in Echo
sounds good
glad that this smart mocha shit is coinciding
:cow:
brand cow
yeah - me too
thats a nice coincidence
